23 import os
24 import sys
25 from fcntl import ioctl
26 from ctypes import c_uint32, c_uint8, c_uint16, c_char, POINTER, Structure, Array, Union, create_string_buffer
27 
28 
29 # Commands from uapi/linux/i2c-dev.h
30 I2C_SLAVE = 0x0703 # Use this slave address
31 I2C_SLAVE_FORCE = 0x0706 # Use this slave address, even if it is already in use by a driver!
32 I2C_FUNCS = 0x0705 # Get the adapter functionality mask
33 I2C_RDWR = 0x0707 # Combined R/W transfer (one STOP only)
34 I2C_SMBUS = 0x0720 # SMBus transfer. Takes pointer to i2c_smbus_ioctl_data
35 
36 # SMBus transfer read or write markers from uapi/linux/i2c.h
37 I2C_SMBUS_WRITE = 0
38 I2C_SMBUS_READ = 1
39 
40 # Size identifiers uapi/linux/i2c.h
41 I2C_SMBUS_BYTE = 1
42 I2C_SMBUS_BYTE_DATA = 2
43 I2C_SMBUS_WORD_DATA = 3
44 I2C_SMBUS_BLOCK_DATA = 5 # Can't get this one to work on my Raspberry Pi
45 I2C_SMBUS_I2C_BLOCK_DATA = 8
46 I2C_SMBUS_BLOCK_MAX = 32
47 
48 # To determine what functionality is present (uapi/linux/i2c.h)
49 I2C_FUNC_I2C = 0x00000001
50 I2C_FUNC_10BIT_ADDR = 0x00000002
51 I2C_FUNC_PROTOCOL_MANGLING = 0x00000004 # I2C_M_IGNORE_NAK etc.
52 I2C_FUNC_SMBUS_PEC = 0x00000008
53 I2C_FUNC_NOSTART = 0x00000010 # I2C_M_NOSTART
54 I2C_FUNC_SLAVE = 0x00000020
55 I2C_FUNC_SMBUS_BLOCK_PROC_CALL = 0x00008000 # SMBus 2.0
56 I2C_FUNC_SMBUS_QUICK = 0x00010000
57 I2C_FUNC_SMBUS_READ_BYTE = 0x00020000
58 I2C_FUNC_SMBUS_WRITE_BYTE = 0x00040000
59 I2C_FUNC_SMBUS_READ_BYTE_DATA = 0x00080000
60 I2C_FUNC_SMBUS_WRITE_BYTE_DATA = 0x00100000
61 I2C_FUNC_SMBUS_READ_WORD_DATA = 0x00200000
62 I2C_FUNC_SMBUS_WRITE_WORD_DATA = 0x00400000
63 I2C_FUNC_SMBUS_PROC_CALL = 0x00800000
64 I2C_FUNC_SMBUS_READ_BLOCK_DATA = 0x01000000
65 I2C_FUNC_SMBUS_WRITE_BLOCK_DATA = 0x02000000
66 I2C_FUNC_SMBUS_READ_I2C_BLOCK = 0x04000000 # I2C-like block xfer
67 I2C_FUNC_SMBUS_WRITE_I2C_BLOCK = 0x08000000 # w/ 1-byte reg. addr.
68 
69 # i2c_msg flags from uapi/linux/i2c.h
70 I2C_M_RD = 0x0001
71 
72 # Pointer definitions
73 LP_c_uint8 = POINTER(c_uint8)
74 LP_c_uint16 = POINTER(c_uint16)
75 LP_c_uint32 = POINTER(c_uint32)
76

79 # Type definitions as in i2c.h

81 
82 class i2c_smbus_data(Array):
83  """
84  Adaptation of the i2c_smbus_data union in ``i2c.h``.
85 
86  Data for SMBus messages.
87  """
88  _length_ = I2C_SMBUS_BLOCK_MAX + 2
89  _type_ = c_uint8
90 
91 
92 class union_i2c_smbus_data(Union):
93  _fields_ = [
94  ("byte", c_uint8),
95  ("word", c_uint16),
96  ("block", i2c_smbus_data)
97  ]
98 
99 
100 union_pointer_type = POINTER(union_i2c_smbus_data)
101 
102 
103 class i2c_smbus_ioctl_data(Structure):
104  """
105  As defined in ``i2c-dev.h``.
106  """
107  _fields_ = [
108  ('read_write', c_uint8),
109  ('command', c_uint8),
110  ('size', c_uint32),
111  ('data', union_pointer_type)]
112  __slots__ = [name for name, type in _fields_]
113 
114  @staticmethod
115  def create(read_write=I2C_SMBUS_READ, command=0, size=I2C_SMBUS_BYTE_DATA):
116  u = union_i2c_smbus_data()
117  return i2c_smbus_ioctl_data(
118  read_write=read_write, command=command, size=size,
119  data=union_pointer_type(u))

123 # Type definitions for i2c_rdwr combined transactions
124 
125 
126 class i2c_msg(Structure):
127  """
128  As defined in ``i2c.h``.
129  """
130  _fields_ = [
131  ('addr', c_uint16),
132  ('flags', c_uint16),
133  ('len', c_uint16),
134  ('buf', POINTER(c_char))]
135  __slots__ = [name for name, type in _fields_]
136 
137  def __iter__(self):
138  return i2c_msg_iter(self)
139 
140  @staticmethod
141  def read(address, length):
142  """
143  Prepares an i2c read transaction.
144 
145  :param address: Slave address.
146  :type: address: int
147  :param length: Number of bytes to read.
148  :type: length: int
149  :return: New :py:class:`i2c_msg` instance for read operation.
150  :rtype: :py:class:`i2c_msg`
151  """
152  arr = create_string_buffer(length)
153  return i2c_msg(
154  addr=address, flags=I2C_M_RD, len=length,
155  buf=arr)
156 
157  @staticmethod
158  def write(address, buf):
159  """
160  Prepares an i2c write transaction.
161 
162  :param address: Slave address.
163  :type address: int
164  :param buf: Bytes to write. Either list of values or str.
165  :type buf: list
166  :return: New :py:class:`i2c_msg` instance for write operation.
167  :rtype: :py:class:`i2c_msg`
168  """
169  if sys.version_info.major >= 3:
170  if type(buf) is str:
171  buf = bytes(buf, 'UTF-8')
172  else:
173  buf = bytes(buf)
174  else:
175  if type(buf) is not str:
176  buf = ''.join([chr(x) for x in buf])
177  arr = create_string_buffer(buf, len(buf))
178  return i2c_msg(
179  addr=address, flags=0, len=len(arr),
180  buf=arr)
181 
182 
183 class i2c_rdwr_ioctl_data(Structure):
184  """
185  As defined in ``i2c-dev.h``.
186  """
187  _fields_ = [
188  ('msgs', POINTER(i2c_msg)),
189  ('nmsgs', c_uint32)
190  ]
191  __slots__ = [name for name, type in _fields_]
192 
193  @staticmethod
194  def create(*i2c_msg_instances):
195  """
196  Factory method for creating a i2c_rdwr_ioctl_data struct that can
197  be called with ``ioctl(fd, I2C_RDWR, data)``.
198 
199  :param i2c_msg_instances: Up to 42 i2c_msg instances
200  :rtype: i2c_rdwr_ioctl_data
201  """
202  n_msg = len(i2c_msg_instances)
203  msg_array = (i2c_msg * n_msg)(*i2c_msg_instances)
204  return i2c_rdwr_ioctl_data(
205  msgs=msg_array,
206  nmsgs=n_msg
207  )
208 
209 
210 class i2c_msg_iter:
211  """
212  :py:class:`i2c_msg` iterator. For convenience.
213  """
214 
215  def __init__(self, msg):
216  self.msg = msg
217  self.idx = 0
218 
219  def __iter__(self):
220  return self
221 
222  def __next__(self):
223  if self.idx < self.msg.len:
224  val = ord(self.msg.buf[self.idx])
225  self.idx += 1
226  return val
227  else:
228  raise StopIteration()
229 
230  def next(self):
231  return self.__next__()
232 
233 #############################################################
234 
235 
236 class SMBus(object):
237 
238  def __init__(self, bus=None, force=False):
239  """
240  Initialize and (optionally) open an i2c bus connection.
241 
242  :param bus: i2c bus number (e.g. 0 or 1). If not given, a subsequent
243  call to ``open()`` is required.
244  :type bus: int
245  :param force: force using the slave address even when driver is
246  already using it.
247  :type force: boolean
248  """
249  self.fd = None
250  self.funcs = 0
251  if bus is not None:
252  self.open(bus)
253  self.address = None
254  self.force = force
255  self._force_last = None
256 
257  def open(self, bus):
258  """
259  Open a given i2c bus.
260 
261  :param bus: i2c bus number (e.g. 0 or 1)
262  :type bus: int
263  """
264  self.fd = os.open("/dev/i2c-{}".format(bus), os.O_RDWR)
265  self.funcs = self._get_funcs()
266 
267  def close(self):
268  """
269  Close the i2c connection.
270  """
271  if self.fd:
272  os.close(self.fd)
273  self.fd = None
274 
275  def _set_address(self, address, force=None):
276  """
277  Set i2c slave address to use for subsequent calls.
278 
279  :param address:
280  :type address: int
281  :param force:
282  :type force: Boolean
283  """
284  force = force if force is not None else self.force
285  if self.address != address or self._force_last != force:
286  if force is True:
287  ioctl(self.fd, I2C_SLAVE_FORCE, address)
288  else:
289  ioctl(self.fd, I2C_SLAVE, address)
290  self.address = address
291  self._force_last = force
292 
293  def _get_funcs(self):
294  """
295  Returns a 32-bit value stating supported I2C functions.
296 
297  :rtype: int
298  """
299  f = c_uint32()
300  ioctl(self.fd, I2C_FUNCS, f)
301  return f.value
302 
303  def read_byte(self, i2c_addr, force=None):
304  """
305  Read a single byte from a device.
306 
307  :rtype: int
308  :param i2c_addr: i2c address
309  :type i2c_addr: int
310  :param force:
311  :type force: Boolean
312  :return: Read byte value
313  """
314  self._set_address(i2c_addr, force=force)
315  msg = i2c_smbus_ioctl_data.create(
316  read_write=I2C_SMBUS_READ, command=0, size=I2C_SMBUS_BYTE
317  )
318  ioctl(self.fd, I2C_SMBUS, msg)
319  return msg.data.contents.byte
320 
321  def write_byte(self, i2c_addr, value, force=None):
322  """
323  Write a single byte to a device.
324 
325  :param i2c_addr: i2c address
326  :type i2c_addr: int
327  :param value: value to write
328  :type value: int
329  :param force:
330  :type force: Boolean
331  """
332  self._set_address(i2c_addr, force=force)
333  msg = i2c_smbus_ioctl_data.create(
334  read_write=I2C_SMBUS_WRITE, command=value, size=I2C_SMBUS_BYTE
335  )
336  ioctl(self.fd, I2C_SMBUS, msg)
337 
338  def read_byte_data(self, i2c_addr, register, force=None):
339  """
340  Read a single byte from a designated register.
341 
342  :param i2c_addr: i2c address
343  :type i2c_addr: int
344  :param register: Register to read
345  :type register: int
346  :param force:
347  :type force: Boolean
348  :return: Read byte value
349  :rtype: int
350  """
351  self._set_address(i2c_addr, force=force)
352  msg = i2c_smbus_ioctl_data.create(
353  read_write=I2C_SMBUS_READ, command=register, size=I2C_SMBUS_BYTE_DATA
354  )
355  ioctl(self.fd, I2C_SMBUS, msg)
356  return msg.data.contents.byte
357 
358  def write_byte_data(self, i2c_addr, register, value, force=None):
359  """
360  Write a byte to a given register.
361 
362  :param i2c_addr: i2c address
363  :type i2c_addr: int
364  :param register: Register to write to
365  :type register: int
366  :param value: Byte value to transmit
367  :type value: int
368  :param force:
369  :type force: Boolean
370  :rtype: None
371  """
372  self._set_address(i2c_addr, force=force)
373  msg = i2c_smbus_ioctl_data.create(
374  read_write=I2C_SMBUS_WRITE, command=register, size=I2C_SMBUS_BYTE_DATA
375  )
376  msg.data.contents.byte = value
377  ioctl(self.fd, I2C_SMBUS, msg)
378 
379  def read_word_data(self, i2c_addr, register, force=None):
380  """
381  Read a single word (2 bytes) from a given register.
382 
383  :param i2c_addr: i2c address
384  :type i2c_addr: int
385  :param register: Register to read
386  :type register: int
387  :param force:
388  :type force: Boolean
389  :return: 2-byte word
390  :rtype: int
391  """
392  self._set_address(i2c_addr, force=force)
393  msg = i2c_smbus_ioctl_data.create(
394  read_write=I2C_SMBUS_READ, command=register, size=I2C_SMBUS_WORD_DATA
395  )
396  ioctl(self.fd, I2C_SMBUS, msg)
397  return msg.data.contents.word
398 
399  def write_word_data(self, i2c_addr, register, value, force=None):
400  """
401  Write a byte to a given register.
402 
403  :param i2c_addr: i2c address
404  :type i2c_addr: int
405  :param register: Register to write to
406  :type register: int
407  :param value: Word value to transmit
408  :type value: int
409  :param force:
410  :type force: Boolean
411  :rtype: None
412  """
413  self._set_address(i2c_addr, force=force)
414  msg = i2c_smbus_ioctl_data.create(
415  read_write=I2C_SMBUS_WRITE, command=register, size=I2C_SMBUS_WORD_DATA
416  )
417  msg.data.contents.word = value
418  ioctl(self.fd, I2C_SMBUS, msg)
419 
420  def read_i2c_block_data(self, i2c_addr, register, length, force=None):
421  """
422  Read a block of byte data from a given register.
423 
424  :param i2c_addr: i2c address
425  :type i2c_addr: int
426  :param register: Start register
427  :type register: int
428  :param length: Desired block length
429  :type length: int
430  :param force:
431  :type force: Boolean
432  :return: List of bytes
433  :rtype: list
434  """
435  if length > I2C_SMBUS_BLOCK_MAX:
436  raise ValueError("Desired block length over %d bytes" % I2C_SMBUS_BLOCK_MAX)
437  self._set_address(i2c_addr, force=force)
438  msg = i2c_smbus_ioctl_data.create(
439  read_write=I2C_SMBUS_READ, command=register, size=I2C_SMBUS_I2C_BLOCK_DATA
440  )
441  msg.data.contents.byte = length
442  ioctl(self.fd, I2C_SMBUS, msg)
443  return msg.data.contents.block[1:length + 1]
444 
445  def write_i2c_block_data(self, i2c_addr, register, data, force=None):
446  """
447  Write a block of byte data to a given register.
448 
449  :param i2c_addr: i2c address
450  :type i2c_addr: int
451  :param register: Start register
452  :type register: int
453  :param data: List of bytes
454  :type data: list
455  :param force:
456  :type force: Boolean
457  :rtype: None
458  """
459  length = len(data)
460  if length > I2C_SMBUS_BLOCK_MAX:
461  raise ValueError("Data length cannot exceed %d bytes" % I2C_SMBUS_BLOCK_MAX)
462  self._set_address(i2c_addr, force=force)
463  msg = i2c_smbus_ioctl_data.create(
464  read_write=I2C_SMBUS_WRITE, command=register, size=I2C_SMBUS_I2C_BLOCK_DATA
465  )
466  msg.data.contents.block[0] = length
467  msg.data.contents.block[1:length + 1] = data
468  ioctl(self.fd, I2C_SMBUS, msg)
469 
470  def i2c_rdwr(self, *i2c_msgs):
471  """
472  Combine a series of i2c read and write operations in a single
473  transaction (with repeted start bits but no stop bits in between).
474 
475  This method takes i2c_msg instances as input, which must be created
476  first with :py:meth:`i2c_msg.read` or :py:meth:`i2c_msg.write`.
477 
478  :param i2c_msgs: One or more i2c_msg class instances.
479  :type i2c_msgs: i2c_msg
480  :rtype: None
481  """
482  ioctl_data = i2c_rdwr_ioctl_data.create(*i2c_msgs)
483  ioctl(self.fd, I2C_RDWR, ioctl_data)
484 
485 
486 class SMBusWrapper:
487  """
488  Wrapper class around the SMBus.
489 
490  Enables the user to wrap access to the :py:class:`SMBus` class in a
491  "with" statement. If auto_cleanup is True (default), the
492  :py:class:`SMBus` handle will be automatically closed
493  upon exit of the ``with`` block.
494  """
495  def __init__(self, bus_number=0, auto_cleanup=True, force=False):
496  """
497  :param auto_cleanup: Close bus when leaving scope.
498  :type auto_cleanup: Boolean
499  :param force: Force using the slave address even when driver is already using it.
500  :type force: Boolean
501  """
502  self.bus_number = bus_number
503  self.auto_cleanup = auto_cleanup
504  self.force = force
505 
506  def __enter__(self):
507  self.bus = SMBus(bus=self.bus_number, force=self.force)
508  return self.bus
509 
510  def __exit__(self, exc_type, exc_val, exc_tb):
511  if self.auto_cleanup:
512  self.bus.close()
